entry.title: Streamlining Education Document Transfer in SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Technical Challenge:

SAP SuccessFactors offers standard integration for education and employment data‚Äîbut only for fields, not attachments. This means that any documents submitted during the recruitment process, do not move to the employee profile upon hiring.

The objective is to have the documents that are verified during background verification, should be part of the employee profile.

What Didn‚Äôt Work: Custom Portlet in Onboarding

One of the options that we thought could help us achieve the objective was creating a custom object in Onboarding and letting the candidate upload the documents there. While creating a custom portlet in Onboarding seemed promising, it had two major flaws:

  • No direct transfer from Job Application to Onboarding: There is no standard solution to move the verified documents from Job Application in Recruiting to Onboarding.
  • User Experience: Asking candidates to upload the required documents in the custom object would not be a good user experience as we are asking to upload same documents twice during the recruitment process.
  • Authenticity and Data Inconsistency: While Candidates re-upload documents, it would increase the risk of data inconsistency and authenticity.

 

What Worked: CPI Integration

We then resolved this issue using SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI) to create a secure, scalable, and candidate-friendly solution. It is successfully implemented for a Norway Oil and Natural Gas customer and is working seamlessly.

Here‚Äôs how we did it:

  1. Created custom portlet for education in Employee Profile.
  2. Mirrored fields in the Job Application template.
  3. Enabled document attachments to flow through CPI.
  4. Set permissions to lock document edits post-offer stage.
  5. Triggered integration based on:
    • ‚úÖ Application Status: ‚ÄòHired‚Äô
    • ‚úÖ Background Check: ‚ÄòCompleted‚Äô
    • ‚úÖ Education Data/Documents: ‚ÄòProvided‚Äô

 Field Mapping Snapshot

Field

Job Application

Employee Profile

Degree

custom_EducationDegree

cust_AchievedDegree

Completion Date

custom_EducationDate

cust_CompletedDate

Documents

attachment2

cust_Documents

Key Takeaway

By leveraging SAP CPI, we ensured a frictionless transfer of education documents‚Äîpreserving authenticity, reducing redundancy, and enhancing the overall HR workflow. This has enabled the HR to have verified and automated flow of Education documents from Recruiting process to Employee Profile in EC and at the same time enhancing End User Experience.

entry.title: Automated Budget Calculation for Spot Awards
entry.content:
Employee recognition is evolving rapidly and so the processes to manage it. Among the various recognition methods spot awards has been a powerful tool to motivate employee and celebrate their employee exceptional contribution. however, HR team often face challenges in managing these awards, as manual efforts and fulfilment can be time consuming and prone to errors.

 With SAP SuccessFactors 2H 2025 release we now have an option to automate our budget calculations for spot awards. This feature helps planner to manage and allocate recognition budget in faster and more efficient way.

What‚Äôs new?

The enhancements allow planners to automatically calculate spot award budgets based on business rules. Instead of manually uploading excel files and budgets,

we can now set up the budget for your Spot Award programs to be calculated automatically by the system.

 The Automated Budget Calculation process includes:

  • Manager Hierarchy: Only standard hierarchies are supported for Automated Budget Calculation.
  • Budget Holders: Can be all managers or a selection based on Dynamic group or a business rule.
  • Budget Allocation: Can be a flat amount, based on a selection of pay components, or on a business rule.

Once the criteria have been met, we can run the draft calculation, preview the system budget, and then choose to finalize or discard these values based on our requirement.

The budget calculation and allocation are managed by jobs within the system, which can be tracked using the Job Monitor. Additionally, we have the option to manually update budgets for budget holders, even when Automated Budget Calculation is enabled.

Configuration Requirements

Go to Reward and Recognition-> Manage Spot Award Programs -> Budget and enable Automated Budget Calculation.

What's Changed

How It Looks Now

In the current version, we can set up criteria and use the system to create budget values for budget holders. The Calculate button is available once the required fields are populated. The Download becomes available once the job to calculate is complete and refreshed the screen for Budget. After we download and review the calculated values, use the Finalize or Discard options to act as desired.

Conclusion: -

Spot awards are a vital part of employee engagement but managing them effectively requires both flexibility and control. With Automated Budget calculations, SAP SuccessFactors compensation empowers HR teams to streamline recognition program, reduce administrative overhead and ensure fairness in budget distribution.

This enhancement is more than a technical upgrade ‚Äì it‚Äôs a step toward making recognition smarted, scalable and sustainable.

entry.title: SAP PPM Configuration: Global Settings, Currency Options and Fiscal Year Variant
entry.content:
Introduction: This Blog Post focuses on Global Settings where consultant can enable / disable the default settings to meet the client specific requirements, Currency Options, how to enable the currency in Portfolio objects and Fiscal Year Variant, where need to be assigned in PPM as well as in Controlling Area.

SAP PPM Configuration:

Topics Covered:

  • Global Settings
  • Currency Options
  • Fiscal Year Variant

Override Default Global Settings: In this customization activity, the default global settings provided by SAP can be modified to align with required values that meet specific business requirements.

Configuration Node: SAP Portfolio and Project Management ‚Äì Portfolio Management ‚Äì Global Customizing ‚Äì Global Settings ‚Äì Override Default Global Settings

Area

Text

Name

Text

Settings Value

Explanation

0006

User Interface Settings

0004

Create Project on Saving Checkbox for Proj. Mgmt <Visible='X' Hidden

X

This will enable / disable  the checkbox option for creation of Project for Project Management (cProject)

0006

User Interface Settings

0005

Proj. Mgmt  Template Visibility <Visible='X' Hidden=' '>

X

This will enable/ disable the Project Management Template

0007

General Default Values

0003

Default Value for Currency

USD

This will enable the default value for currency, say for example you want to enable the INR as default currency in PPM, you should maintain currency as INR

0010

Portfolio Item FI/CO Planning and Integration

0006

Fiscal Year Switch (see SAP Note 1457426)

K4

To display the data in Fiscal Year format, the Fiscal Year variant must be consistent between the Item and the controlling element. This consistency is essential for importing planning data from the Portfolio Item to the controlling object, such as WBS or Internal Order.

0010

Portfolio Item FI/CO Planning and Integration

0007

Default Fiscal year variant (see SAP Note 1457426)

K4

With this setting, the Fiscal Year variant can be automatically defaulted. Since different countries have varying fiscal year periods for financial controlling and data processing, this configuration allows for the appropriate Fiscal Year variant to be set as the default.

 

Currency Option in Bucket:

In the Bucket, under the Financial and Capacity Information tab, you need to select a Currency, as this is a mandatory field by default in SAP. While it can be changed to optional, it is recommended to keep mandatory fields intact at the Bucket level, as they will affect the subsequent associated Initiatives and Items for Financial and Capacity planning.

Regardless of previous settings where you may have maintained a default currency value, such as INR, you will only see two options as default in the Bucket: "United States Dollar" and "European Euro," as illustrated in the screenshot below.

Now, let‚Äôs see what is there in the configuration which is defaulting these currencies in Bucket.

Configuration Node: SAP Portfolio and Project Management ‚Äì Portfolio Management ‚Äì Global  Customizing ‚Äì Portfolio-Independent Settings ‚Äì Define Currency Units

We can see here USD and EUR are maintained by default:

Let‚Äôs add INR and then we will see further in Bucket.

Now we can see Indian Rupee option also got enabled in Bucket.

Settings of Fiscal Year Variant in PPM and PS:

The Fiscal Year Variant plays an important role in financial postings and in linking the PPM with the Project System WBS or Internal Order.

Assignment of Fiscal Year Variant in PPM.

Configuration Node: SAP Portfolio and Project Management ‚Äì Portfolio  Management ‚Äì Global Customizing ‚Äì Global Settings ‚Äì Override Default Global Settings

Area

Text

Name

Text

Settings Value

Explanation

0010

Portfolio Item FI/CO Planning and Integration

0006

Fiscal Year Switch (see SAP Note 1457426)

K4

To display the data in Fiscal Year format, the Fiscal Year variant must be consistent between the Item and the controlling element. This consistency is essential for importing planning data from the Portfolio Item to the controlling object, such as WBS or Internal Order.

0010

Portfolio Item FI/CO Planning and Integration

0007

Default Fiscal year variant (see SAP Note 1457426)

K4

With this setting, the Fiscal Year variant can be automatically defaulted. Since different countries have varying fiscal year periods for financial controlling and data processing, this configuration allows for the appropriate Fiscal Year variant to be set as the default.

Fiscal Year Variant in Portfolio Type:

Configuration Node: SAP Portfolio and Project Management ‚Äì Portfolio Management ‚Äì Global Customizing ‚Äì Portfolio Dependent Settings ‚Äì Define Portfolio Types

Fiscal Year Variant in SAP Project System:

The Fiscal Year variant for the Project WBS is determined in the background based on the Controlling Areas assigned to the Project. It is important that the controlling area has the same Fiscal Year variant as the one set in PPM.

Transaction Code: OKKP

Validate / maintain the required Fiscal Year Variant in Other Settings section.

Note: If the Fiscal Year variant in the Controlling Area is different from the one configured in PPM, you may receive an error when transferring Planned Costs or Budgets from the PPM Item to the PS Project, indicating that ‚ÄúNo planning element has been assigned to this item‚Äù.

Conclusion:

By reviewing the settings mentioned in this article, you will be able to:

1. Override the default Global Settings provided by SAP, allowing you to enable or disable various functionalities as explained in this article.
2. Enable the necessary currency option at the bucket level for financial planning.
3. Ensure that the same fiscal year variant is maintained in both PPM and the controlling areas used in PS.

SAP Portfolio and Project Management  SAP Portfolio and Project Management for SAP S/4HANA PLM Project System (PS)

entry.title: How to Replicate Currency Exchange rate from SAP S/4 HANA to Ariba Strategic Sourcing Suite
entry.content:
Dear All,

With this blog i am trying to showcase how can we automatically replicate the exchange rate from S/4 HANA to Ariba Strategic Sourcing Suite.

There has been always a challenge to replicate the exchange rate  and keep both system in sync when you are only using strategic sourcing suite realm. The standard Program ARBCIG_MASTER_DATA_EXPORT gives you an option to replicate the currency conversion for Solution Procure to Pay and Procure to Order and then it gets synchronized to upstream through an ICM Parameter enablement Application.AQS.EnableCurrencyConversionRateSetSync .

But this option doesn't appear when we select sourcing and contract as a solution in standard program

Procure to Pay

Procure to Order

Sourcing and Contracts

Customer often keeps complaining about the desynchronization of exchange rate as  they don't update it regularly in Ariba Upstream which is a manual process. It can be said that Bidding currency in Sourcing Event and the Order currency always differs because Bidding currency is fetch from Ariba and Order Currency will be fetch from S/4 HANA if you are creating a PO in S/4 HANA through an Integration from Ariba sourcing.

The committee who opens the Bids in Sourcing Event has finalized a supplier to award with bidding currency other  than their  base currency. In that case, the price which is finalized in sourcing event should be same  for that item when PO in created in S/4 HANA. for the big value projects even a slight variance in exchange can bring the price variance. This breaks the compliance.

I am sure different customers must have figured out their own ways to replicate exchange rate. However,  we will try to see how can we achieve it through one of the approach.

Steps to Achieve  this requirement:

1) Create a Z custom program by copying the standard program ARBCIG_MASTER_DATA_EXPORT and change the logic such that when we select Sourcing and Contracts as a solution , the Currencyconversion master data check option is available.

2) If we understand the standard program and try to replicate the supported master data  for e.g. plant it can be seen from the xml of MasterDataReplication_Async_Out payload in SRT_MONI that the program uses  Parameter name as "event" and parameter value as "Import External System Master data" and operation as "Load and Delete"

However when we use the same logic for Z program , the integration will fail as "Import External System Master data"  doesn't support currencyconversion csv file

 

 

 

3)To understand which csv file support currency conversion, lets download data dictionary This gives us a little hint on what parameter values we should pass in our Z program. In the data dictionary we could see that Import Master Data Batch Pull supports currency conversion csv

 

4) The z program logic should be written in such a way that it passes Parameter value as " Import Master data batch" and operation as "Load" and only data carrying currenyconversion.csv file should be passed. the standard program logic sends schema.csv file along with currency conversion. that part of logic should be removed.

5) Now it is understood that, master data data replication happens through direct connectivity. The program  reads the master data and creates a csv file in directory. From the al11 directory, program pushes the data to CIG by triggering a proxy from S/4 HANA and it reaches CIG and import task pulls the data to Ariba strategic sourcing.

 

6) Lets try to understand what  CSV file format it accepts so that we can send the data from Z program accordingly. From the below snap you can see if we send the data in this format then only the data will get imported successfully.

 

7) In S/4 HANA we shall create a structure  like wise. Now this structure needs to be mapped to Ariba specific value as it has all capital letters. 

We will maintain the  Ariba specific values in table ARBCIG_FIELDMAP  so that the Z program will take the mapping of  Ariba values from SAP structure

üòéNow lets try to run the Z program and see the behavior

Maintain an exchange rate entry S/4 HANA 

for eg CAD- SAR   Exchange rate 2.7

 

9) Execute the Z program

Output:

cxml payload in completed status in CIG

Go to Administration-> Import Export and search batch and you will see that it has successfully pulled the currency conversion data from S/4 HANA. 

You can also check currencyconversion.csv file to see the latest entry.

 

Now lets try to create a guided sourcing Event and see if we see the updated exchange rate value under system currency conversion

The exchange rate updated successfully and is now in sync with S/4 system. The Z program can be scheduled as a batch job for a daily frequency. The program logic is written in a way  that it keeps checking exchange rate update for last 60 days

Note : For example if your Base currency is SAR, and you maintained the exchange rate for INR to USD then the program will successfully replicate the exchange rate to Ariba strategic sourcing suite and will update the data in currencyconversion.csv file. However, when you create a sourcing event and try to look for the exchange rate  INR-> USD it will not display, the system currency conversion will display all exchange rate conversion against your base currency only.

 

Thank you so much

Cheers!!

entry.title: POWL - How to configure a custom TM query as a functional consultant
entry.content:
Personalized object worklists (POWLs) are a major part of the day-to-day life of any SAP user, whether a consultant implementing SAP ERP for a client or an end user running their core business processes in SAP.

Users often desire to set up their home page in a particular way, preferring to see information that is most relevant to them, which provides actionable insights to perform their job responsibilities in an efficient manner.

In this blog post, let us see, as a functional consultant, how to quickly configure a new TM POWL query w/o disrupting the standard provided ones and assign it to an existing application and category.

Step 1: Create a query

Go to transaction POWL_QUERY

Standard provided ‚Äì

Create new ‚Äì

Provide a query ID and description

Step 2:

Assign SCMTMS_TOR_TO as POWL type ID, which is a standard provided POWL type for freight orders containing its feeder class that is responsible for making the POWL as an interactive report/worklist.

Step 3:

Register the new query with the application ID for freight orders.

Go to transaction POWL_COCKPIT.

Select the application (app) that you want this new query to be registered to and click ‚ÄúRegister Query‚Äù.

In this case, it‚Äôs the Freight Orders ‚Äì Worklist app.

Add a new entry

You can also register the new query to a security role; a blank role means systemwide assignment.

Activate the query and provide the query, tab, and category sequence.

Step 4:

Validate new query registration; the description from the query is shown with a hyperlink.

Step 5:

Register a new category

Create a new category and provide a description

Update the new category in the query registration

Result ‚Äì

Step 6:

Add query fields to the quick search

I personally like to include administrative fields like Max. No. of Records, Created by, Changed by, Created on, and Changed on fields.

You can also make fields mandatory, read only and hidden.

Click accept.

Step 7:

Provide default/pre-configured parameters.

You can provide default parameters like FO type, Max. no. of records (ex, 999 instead of 500) or Creation type (P ‚Äìplanning or M ‚Äì manual), etc.

Click Accept.

Result ‚Äì

Query settings and parameters are updated.

There are a lot more POWL features to explore; any feedback/comments are welcome.

entry.title: Re: Inbound delivery creation issue..
entry.content:
I could see some common issues with GN_DELIVERY_CREATE are

You commented out ls_komdlgn-vbeln = ls_ekko-ebeln. For inbound deliveries, the FM expects the PO number (EBELN) to be passed as reference. Without it, the system doesn‚Äôt know which PO you‚Äôre basing the delivery on.

EKPO-EBELP is numeric but delivery expects a 5‚Äëcharacter string (e.g., '00010'). If you pass 10, it will fail. Use CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT to pad it.

ls_komdlgn-spdnr should be the vendor (LIFNR), but inbound deliveries also require partner determination. If you skip partner dialog (if_no_partner_dialog = 'X'), you must ensure vendor is valid and assigned in customizing.

At minimum, you need:

  • ls_vbsk-vstel (shipping point)
  • ls_vbsk-lfart (delivery type, e.g., EL)
  • ls_vbsk-bedat (delivery date)

Right now you only set bedat. Without vstel and lfart, the FM errors out.

You set no_commit = 'X'. That means the FM won‚Äôt save the delivery. If you want the delivery created even with errors, remove this or call BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT afterwards.

entry.title: The Future of Supply Chain Management | Part 2 of 6
entry.content:
Supply Chain 2035: How Data, AI, and Agents are Changing Supply Chain Planning

In the discussion about the future of supply chain management, one area is increasingly at the center: planning. Supply chain planning not only affects operational efficiency, but directly influences a company‚Äôs service quality, fixed capital and responsiveness. Our joint study from SAP Business Consulting and K√ºhne Logistics University clearly shows that companies that are already planning proactively today can avoid bottlenecks, optimize costs, and exploit potential in a targeted manner.

Supply chain planning is the central lever for anticipating problems before they arise. Companies that anticipate bottlenecks and proactively manage capacity, inventory and resources avoid hectic ‚Äúfire fighting‚Äù in day-to-day operations. Planning thus acts as an early warning system that not only enables stable service, but also more efficient use of resources and proactive action. Effective planning also requires seamless integration and evaluation of a variety of internal and external data sources ‚Äì from granular sales data to basic economic data, to production, procurement, and distribution plans. Different planning levels and horizons need to be connected, and this is where there are huge opportunities for artificial intelligence that can process data volumes, identify patterns, and improve predictions. Advanced planning processes will become a matter of course over the next ten years. If you do not achieve at least a modern, integrated planning level by 2035, you risk not only a competitive disadvantage, but also the loss of operational control capability.

Our survey of supply chain decision-makers (see figure) provides a clear picture of the future. Many expect planning to be much simpler and more intuitive in 2035 than today. More than half expect generative AI and GPT models to have a significant impact on planning processes, and much of it sees data quality as a critical factor in planning decisions. In addition, many expect the breakthrough of new AI-powered forecasting tools that incorporate additional data sources and significantly improve demand planning. Around a quarter expect advanced risk analysis to provide the ability to proactively detect and mitigate disruptions.

However, the status quo shows how big the gap between aspirations and reality is. Only a small number of companies rated their planning as mature in our survey. Similarly, few are actively experimenting with GenAI or GPT applications in the planning environment. Only a minority has very accurate planning data harmonized from different sources. Highly automated demand planning with minimal human intervention is the exception, as are planning systems that provide clear recommendations for action in the event of disruptions. This discrepancy shows that the path to truly modern, intelligent planning is still long and requires targeted investment, clear priorities and structured action.

In order to close this gap, different approaches must be pursued. Companies where planning is a strategic core process or requires very individual processes can realize enormous potential with agent-based AI. With the advent of new agency tools, most repetitive, error-prone work is automated, allowing planners to focus on value-added analytics and decisions. Companies with standardized processes and a low strategic relevance of planning will be able to procure their planning function more as a service in the future. Technology and platform models could enable true end-to-end planning across company boundaries for the first time. Simulations and digital twins will also play a growing role. Although these often fail today due to complexity, modeling effort, and scalability, AI-powered modeling agents could significantly accelerate and improve the accuracy of simulation creation and updates in the future, making their use more practical in larger networks.

Regardless of the individual target image, there are measures that every company should tackle immediately (‚Äúno-regret moves‚Äù). This includes building robust data governance and harmonizing master data as the foundation for any data-driven planning. Unfortunately, the principle of ‚Äúgarbage in, garbage out‚Äù also applies with AI: without high-quality data, even the best AI system cannot deliver meaningful value. A consistent, company-wide IBP system enabling a S&OP process provides the basis for a common planning goal. Initial pilot projects with agent-based sales forecasting help gather experience with AI-powered planning approaches. Finally, it is important to actively link existing planning platforms, such as SAP IBP, with AI services to unlock integration potential early on.

Supply chain planning is now more important than ever and will become a key differentiator between successful companies and those left behind by 2035. The technologies to make planning smarter, faster, and more resilient already exist ‚Äì but they must be combined with clear goals, a resilient data foundation, and organizational readiness for change. Those who lay the foundations today will not only be able to plan faster and more precisely tomorrow but can also act strategically before others can even react.

Figure: Results of an online survey of 119 SC managers with people responsibility, conducted on 01/2025 as part of a joint SAP KLU study

This article was written in collaboration with Prof. Kai Hoberg (K√ºhne Logistics University) in the context of the SAP-KLU study "The Supply Chain of the Future‚Äù.

entry.title: asset history sheet
entry.content:
Hello experts ,

Are you able to explain to us, what the difference between both Axis Properties "Data-Based" and "Aggregation-Based" is in APP _: asset history sheet in sap public cloud .

 

 

I'm asking because I'm still trying to find the right way to present data in "Asset History Sheet". This report should include only active assets as well as assets deactivated within the reporting fiscal year.

 

The main deactivation ways are as follows:

  • transfer from Asset under Construction to a fixed asset & closing of an investment WBS Element;
  • scrapping;
  • sale to 3rd party;
  • sale between IC companies.

 

For all retirement types ‚Äì aside from IC sale ‚Äì the standard AHS-Report with "None" Axis Properties is quite understandable: only assets deactivated after the cutover for balance carryforward in mid-December are moved to the report for the new year.

But when it comes to the asset IC sale, there is a bug that we can't get trustworthy explained by SAP, for example: in the AHS for October '25, we still see lots of assets sold internally in 2023 (e.g. 20000245-0, 30002028-0) and in 2024 (e.g. 30000856-0, 60000928-0).

 

I thought that maybe another display ("Data-Based" and "Aggregation-Based") could be useful.

Indeed, assets deactivated in previous years aren't shown there, but at the same time assets acquired and retired in the current year are missing there too, even if they haven‚Äôt been deactivated yet

 

 

 

The number of displayed columns is also limited in "Data-Based" and "Aggregation-Based" displays in comparison to ‚ÄúNone‚Äù and seems not to include those whose values are zero, e.g. missing important column "Net Book Value at Reporting Date" in the file for some IT equipment.

 

Is there any other possibility to solve the issue with presentation of assets deactivated in previous fiscal years (without manipulating the filters on deactivation date)?

entry.title: Re: Error during Goods Receipt Reversal
entry.content:
The error ‚ÄúInspection Lot was partly posted‚Äù means that the inspection lot created during the original goods receipt has already had some postings (such as usage decisions or partial stock postings). In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, once an inspection lot is partly processed, you cannot directly reverse the goods receipt. Instead, you must first reverse or cancel the inspection lot postings (e.g., usage decision, stock postings) before attempting the GR reversal

Why because when you post a goods receipt for a purchase order with QM active, SAP automatically creates an inspection lot. If you move stock from quality inspection to unrestricted, scrap, or any other status, the inspection lot is considered partly posted. The reversal process checks the inspection lot status. If it is not fully open (status CRTD), reversal is blocked.

To resolve this, perform the below steps

  • Use transaction QA32 (Manage Inspection Lots) or the Fiori app Manage Inspection Lots. Verify if a usage decision or partial stock posting has already been made.
  • If stock was moved from quality inspection to unrestricted or blocked, you need to reverse those material movements first either via MBST or Fiori Cancel Material Documents. If a usage decision was made, you must cancel it (if allowed) or adjust the stock postings accordingly.
  • Ensure all quantities are back in the quality inspection stock type. The inspection lot should be in CRTD status (no postings).
  • Once the inspection lot is clean, use the Reverse Goods Receipt app or API in Public Cloud to cancel the GR

Below steps are required to transform an Intelligent RPA tenant to a Build Process Automation tenant.

Pre-requisites

To ensure a smooth and effortless migration, we provide in-place migration capabilities. However, certain requirements must be met to prevent data loss and incomplete transformations.

Steps to be followed - Click on "Enable migration" 

Connect IRPA Factory. A new tile should be displayed.

 

 

The button "Enable Migration" would be shown. Click and a confirmation is required.

 

 

Note

  • Impact if the migration flag is not enabled:

entry.title: Fiori Elements Value Help token shows GUID instead of text for custom ValueList (CAP / OData V4)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm working on a CAP (Node.js) + Fiori Elements V4 application on SAP BTP (Cloud Foundry). In a List Report for ProductReviews, I have a filter field Product Manager that uses a custom Value Help (ValueList) based on a projection entity ProductManagerEntities.

Problem: In the Value Help dialog, the table correctly shows the Full Name of the product managers, but in the "Selected Items and Conditions" section at the bottom, the token shows the GUID (ID) instead of the full name.

I would like the token to display the full name, not the ID.

Environment

  • SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry
  • CAP (Node.js), OData V4
  • Fiori Elements V4 ‚Äì List Report / Object Page
  • UI5 version (launchpad): 1.13x / 1.14x (dev launchpad)
  • Service: GlobalAssetPortalService

Data Model (simplified)

db/schema.cds

entity ProductReviews : cuid, managed {
  product : Association to one Products not null;

  @Common.FilterDefaultValue: 'OPEN'
  status  : String enum {
    OPEN;
    COMPLETED;
  } default 'OPEN';
}

entity ProductManagerEntities as
  select from ProductReviews distinct {
    key product.productManager.ID as productManagerId,
    key product.productManager.ID as ID,
    product.productManager as productManager,
    (product.productManager.firstName || ' ' || product.productManager.lastName) as fullName : String,
    product.productManager.mail  as mail,
    product.productManager.phone as phone
  } where status = 'OPEN';

Service Projections

srv/gap-service.cds

@cds.redirection.target: false
entity ProductReviews as projection on my.ProductReviews {
    *,
    key product.ID as productId : UUID @title: '{i18n>lblProductNumber}',
    product.productManager.ID as productManagerId : String @title: '{i18n>lblProductManager}',
    product.productManager as productManager
};

@cds.redirection.target: false
entity ProductManagerEntities as projection on my.ProductManagerEntities {
    *
};

Annotations for List Report / Value Help

app/productreviews/annotations.cds

using GlobalAssetPortalService as service from '../../srv/gap-service';

annotate service.ProductReviews with @UI.HeaderInfo: {
    Title         : '{i18n>lblProductReviewTitle}',
    TypeNamePlural: '{i18n>lblProductReviewTitle}'
};

annotate service.ProductReviews with @(
    UI.SelectionFields: [ productManager_ID ]
);

// LineItem: Product Number navigates to Products app via IBN
annotate service.ProductReviews with @UI.LineItem: [
    {
        $Type         : 'UI.DataFieldWithIntentBasedNavigation',
        Label         : '{i18n>lblProductNumber}',
        Value         : productId,
        SemanticObject: 'products',
        Action        : 'display',
        Mapping       : [{
            $Type                 : 'Common.SemanticObjectMappingType',
            LocalProperty         : productId,
            SemanticObjectProperty: 'ID',
        }]
    },
    { $Type: 'UI.DataField', Value: product.productName },
    { $Type: 'UI.DataField', Value: product.productManager_ID },
    { $Type: 'UI.DataField', Value: product.productStatus_code }
]
{
    productManagerId @UI.ExcludeFromNavigationContext: true @UI.HiddenFilter;

    // Text for Product Number works fine in the list
    productId @(
        Common.Text                    : product.productNumber,
        Common.Text.@UI.TextArrangement: #TextOnly
    );

    // Value Help for Product Manager filter
    productManager @(
        Common.Text            : fullName,
        Common.TextArrangement : #TextOnly,
        Common.ValueList: {
            $Type         : 'Common.ValueListType',
            CollectionPath: 'ProductManagerEntities',
            Parameters    : [
                {
                    $Type            : 'Common.ValueListParameterInOut',
                    LocalDataProperty: productManager_ID,
                    ValueListProperty: 'productManagerId'
                },
                {
                    $Type            : 'Common.ValueListParameterDisplayOnly',
                    ValueListProperty: 'fullName'
                },
                {
                    $Type            : 'Common.ValueListParameterDisplayOnly',
                    ValueListProperty: 'mail'
                },
                {
                    $Type            : 'Common.ValueListParameterDisplayOnly',
                    ValueListProperty: 'phone'
                }
            ]
        },
        Common.ValueListWithFixedValues: false
    );
};

Current Behaviour

  • In the Value Help dialog for Product Manager, the table shows fullName correctly.
  • In the Selected Items and Conditions area, the selected token still displays the GUID (productManagerId) instead of fullName.

Expected Behaviour

When the user selects a product manager in the Value Help, the filter value (token) in Selected Items and Conditions should display the full name, e.g. Markus Kellermeyer, while the underlying technical value used for filtering remains the GUID (productManagerId).

What I Already Considered

  1. Setting @Common.Text on the association productManager (see code above).
  2. Using TextArrangement: #TextOnly.
  3. Making sure fullName is part of the ValueList parameters as DisplayOnly.

However, the token still shows the raw GUID.

Questions

  1. For a custom ValueList (CAP projection entity), where exactly should I put the @Common.Text annotation so that the "Selected Items and Conditions" token uses fullName instead of the GUID?
    For example, would this be the correct place:
    annotate service.ProductManagerEntities with {
    productManagerId @Common: {
        Text           : fullName,
        TextArrangement: #TextOnly
    };
};
  2. Is there any special requirement in Fiori Elements V4 for filter fields using value helps so that the token displays text instead of ID?
  3. Is there a minimal example or official documentation that shows the recommended way of doing this with a custom ValueList entity in CAP + Fiori Elements V4?

Any hints, examples, or best practices for this scenario would be highly appreciated. Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Mass changes to purchasing contracts, delete price co...
entry.content:
The Excel template includes a Deletion Indicator column, but this is not yet enabled for processing in the backend logic of the mass change app. SAP documentation Mass Changes to Purchase Contracts  confirms that "Using the offline mode, you can create, update, and delete multiple purchase contracts and purchase contract items in one go using Microsoft Excel". However, the deletion capability applies to contracts/items, not to individual condition records. When you mark a condition for deletion in Excel, the system does not recognize it as a change because the condition group ID and validity remain intact, so the upload logic treats it as ‚Äúno change".

So you have the below options

Use the Manage Purchasing Contracts Fiori app to delete the condition record directly. This is the only supported way right now.

Instead of deleting, you can set the condition value to 0 or adjust validity dates to effectively deactivate the condition. This ensures the condition is no longer applied, even though it remains in the contract.

my colleague from the ABAP Kernel team made a correction for this. The special ok-code will be absorbed, so that it does not reach the processing of ST05 (or any other transaction). It is planned to be a part of the next ABAP kernel release. It is also considered for a kernel patch, but currently ranked as low priority. So it is currently not clear whether this correction will be available as a kernel patch or not.

Best regards,
Armin

entry.title: Re: How to Prevent Shipping Costs from Being Distributed...
entry.content:
Good day @Husi 

Thank you for your question.

Please review these references for more details:

KBA 3618341, Distribution Between Header and Items, Header Level, Header and Item Conditions

So, the answer to your question is no, not in cloud when you use standard pricing. You have the option to either proportionally distribute the cost or have the same amount copied to each item. What you are currently experiencing is a public cloud restriction. Freight surcharge at the header as you mentioned are only a convenience UI. Considering your total freight is distributed proportionally to the items, that indicates your condition type is marked as Group Condition. If it is not marked as Group Condition, then the same freight amount will be copied to each item, which you also don‚Äôt want.

To summarise, depending on your business case, if you want to see freight only once in the document, you should consider:

  • Keeping your current distribution but adjust forms to show only the header total, or
  • Replacing the header freight condition with a separate freight item in your sales order, which then appears once and posts to a freight revenue account you dedicate, or
  • Making use of TM-based charge management, where your freight is managed and posted separately.

So, from the public clouds clean-core perspective, the simplest way for you to ensure freight appears only once without relying on the header distribution is to model your freight as a dedicated sales order item.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Fiori Elements Value Help token shows GUID instead of...
entry.content:
@ncrim7 

You need to add this annotation to your ProductManagerEntities:

annotate service.ProductManagerEntities with {
    @Common.Text: fullName
    @Common.TextArrangement: #TextOnly
    ID
};

The @Common.Text annotation on the ID field of the ValueList entity itself is what makes Fiori Elements display text instead of GUID in filter tokens.

entry.title: Re: Cannot find custom G/L acct under default transport r...
entry.content:
Hello @khanhlynx99 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following link. It explains how the transports and the required business configuration flows. https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b249d650b15e4b3d9fc2077ee921abd0/1a02302321054e6ab4d9e7244156d31b.html?locale=en-US

Based on your screenshots and details, you cannot create G/L accounts through the Manage G/L Account Master Data app in public cloud. Transport requests do not capture that either. The reason is G/L master data is part of Business Configuration content and not to technical customising which is transported through the Export Customising Transports App. Therefore, you will not see any popup when you create G/L account, system will not add any entries to DEFAULT_CUST/CUSY and your G/L account will not appear in any transport request.

To summarise, in public cloud G/L account master data is transferred to the test and production system when you activate content and not through customer transports. Ony configuration items that are maintained through SSCUIs for example Automatic Account Determination can generate transport entries. This is the reason why you only see that activity in your Export Customizing Transports App.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: BRf+ - OPD Transition Help Condition Determination
entry.content:
Dear @GAK1,

Could you clarify your question, customer number?

My suggestion is based on additional fields, with this EDI vs FORM custom field approach you actually never maintain customer numbers directly in OPD.
All customer-specific logic goes into the new BP field; OPD only reads the value of that field.

For every customer:

  1. Open Manage Customer Master Data
  2. Go to the General data or where you enabled the field.
  3. You‚Äôll see your new Output Channel (EDI/FORM) field.
  4. Set:
    • EDI for EDI customers.
    • FORM or leave empty for paper/email customers.
  5. Save.

From now on:

  • OPD reads this field via Condition Parameters of Application.
  • You never touch customer numbers in OPD just this one custom field on the BP.

Bet Regards,

Dawid
